story:
THE SHOW:


Yes! The world famous cast of the Whiteman’s Whiskey Comedy Revue has returned to television to bring you the most important show you’ll ever see! Yes! It’s the same night of comedy and song and TV Town extravagance that you’ve grown to love and never want to miss! And Yes! Of course you can count on special guests and famous friends to drop by, leading to those “can’t miss moments” that the Whiteman’s Whiskey Comedy Revue is famous for! What makes this show so important? Come celebrate with the Whiteman’s Whiskey Comedy Revue, who, for the first time ever, have left TV Town to honour the bravery and spirit of our Boys fighting in the conflict overseas! Yes, that’s right! The Whiteman’s Whiskey Comedy Revue will be broadcast live from Land of Sun and Sand so that the Soldiers don’t have to come home! And No! Not even the Invisible Hand of Evil could disrupt the joy and laughs the Whiteman’s Stars are bringing with them, not even if he tried! So Yes! Join the Whiteman’s cast including Dick Powell, Nicky Darling, Chester Knuckles, Professor Smoats, The Buck Wheaton Trio and many more as they provide morale, welfare and recreation-type services to our Boys away from home, and more importantly, make TV History!


OR, IN OTHER WORDS:

 

Inspired by the bygone variety shows of television’s Golden Age, Whiteman’s (pronounced “Wit-Mans” and “it’s for everybody!”) is an honest homage to a forgotten era while remaining a dark and sincere commentary on the roots of North American comedy.

 

The Whiteman’s Whiskey Comedy Revue is at once an imaginative musical revue, sketch comedy and absurdist drama that comes equipped with one of Montreal’s finest jazz ensembles, the Buck Wheaton Trio.


More about the Whiteman's Whiskey World here.  

 

WHAT WE NEED & AND WHAT YOU GET:

 

The Whiteman's Whiskey Comedy Revue is a big team. Between your beloved core cast of Dick, Nicky, Chester Knuckles and Professor Smoats, new special guests for our overseas show, and of course the formidable Buck Wheaton Trio (actually a quartet of Montréal's finest jazz musicians), not to mention designers and stage management, One of Everything for the Boys becomes a huge undertaking for our small theatre company.  

 

Since its inception in 2006, SideMart has always paid its nationally-recognized collaborators a fair, union wage. Your donations will assist this process by financing essential production elements such as the musicians, sets, costumes, and a portion of our publicity campaign.

 

THE COMPANY:

SideMart Theatrical Grocery is an ensemble of professional theatre artists unwavering in its belief in the importance of building a vibrant and confident English theatre community in Montreal.


SideMart is dedicated to the creation, development and production of revelatory and intelligently crafted theatre that’s not afraid to let the seams show and that believes in magic; theatre infused with pathos and humour that aims to stimulate, astonish and challenge its audience and peers.

SideMart believes in a holistic theatrical experience; one that explores the entire environment and reminds the audience that theatre is a shared event  that extends to all corners of the space it inhabits.

SideMart strives to mine humanity’s dirty underbelly, seeking the revelation of beauty in the desperate, the broken: the human.


Visit the SideMart website here.
story_txt:
THE SHOW:





Yes! The world famous cast of the Whiteman’s
Whiskey Comedy Revue has returned to television to bring you the most important
show you’ll ever see! Yes! It’s the same night of comedy and song and TV Town
extravagance that you’ve grown to love and never want to miss! And Yes! Of
course you can count on special guests and famous friends to drop by, leading
to those “can’t miss moments” that the Whiteman’s Whiskey Comedy Revue is
famous for! What makes this show so important? Come celebrate with the
Whiteman’s Whiskey Comedy Revue, who, for the first time ever, have left TV
Town to honour the bravery and spirit of our Boys fighting in the conflict
overseas! Yes, that’s right! The Whiteman’s Whiskey Comedy Revue will be
broadcast live from Land of Sun and Sand so that the Soldiers don’t have to
come home! And No! Not even the Invisible Hand of Evil could disrupt the joy
and laughs the Whiteman’s Stars are bringing with them, not even if he tried!
So Yes! Join the Whiteman’s cast including Dick Powell, Nicky Darling, Chester
Knuckles, Professor Smoats, The Buck Wheaton Trio and many more as they provide
morale, welfare and recreation-type services to our Boys away from home, and
more importantly, make TV History!



OR, IN OTHER WORDS:
 
Inspired by the bygone variety shows of
television’s Golden Age, Whiteman’s (pronounced
“Wit-Mans” and “it’s for everybody!”) is an honest homage to a forgotten era
while remaining a dark and sincere commentary on the roots of North American
comedy.
 
The Whiteman’s Whiskey Comedy Revue is at once an imaginative
musical revue, sketch comedy and absurdist drama that comes equipped with one
of Montreal’s finest jazz ensembles, the Buck Wheaton Trio.

More about the Whiteman's Whiskey World here.  
 
WHAT WE NEED
& AND WHAT YOU GET:
 
The Whiteman's Whiskey Comedy Revue is a big
team. Between your beloved core cast of Dick, Nicky, Chester Knuckles and
Professor Smoats, new special guests for our overseas show, and of course
the formidable Buck Wheaton Trio (actually a
quartet of Montréal's finest jazz musicians), not to mention designers and
stage management, One of Everything for the Boys becomes a huge undertaking for our small theatre company.  
 
Since its inception in 2006, SideMart has
always paid its nationally-recognized collaborators a fair, union wage. Your
donations will assist this process by financing essential production elements such as the musicians, sets, costumes, and a portion of our publicity campaign.
 THE COMPANY:
SideMart Theatrical Grocery is an ensemble of
professional theatre artists unwavering in its belief in the importance of
building a vibrant and confident English theatre community in Montreal.





SideMart is dedicated to the creation,
development and production of revelatory and intelligently crafted theatre that’s
not afraid to let the seams show and that believes in magic; theatre infused
with pathos and humour that aims to stimulate, astonish and challenge its
audience and peers.
SideMart believes in a holistic theatrical
experience; one that explores the entire environment and reminds the audience
that theatre is a shared event  that extends to all corners of the space
it inhabits.
SideMart strives to mine humanity’s dirty
underbelly, seeking the revelation of beauty in the desperate, the broken: the
human.

Visit the SideMart website here.

story:
"Were Lovers"

An exploration of the manifestation of love through the works of Charles L. Mee.

 

Love can be a filthy, beautiful, ugly, wonderful, sickening thing and as irrational and painful as it may sometimes be there are those who still find themselves caught in the pain and pleasures of it. These are their stories.

 

Rarely Pure Theatre, an emerging theatre collective, continues to produce work that offers stunning plots and imagery as well as innovative ways of live story telling. The collective was created by a diverse group of theatre school graduates, including Ryerson and University of Windsor, who dare to explore an ever-shifting identity through the visceral means of theatre.

 

 

Where will your money go? 

We are raising funds to get this workshopped production on it's feet! We want to bring the words of Charles Mee to life and we need your help! 

Funds will go to:

-supporting Charles Mee's (re)making project

-props and costumes

-rehearsal space

Please check out the perks to see what we can offer you in return :-)

 

 

The Impact

This show explores the many different ways that love can manifest itself in our lives. Everyone falls in and out of love, and it often breaks us and builds us back up again. Love is something we should re-cultivate every single day.

"Were Lovers" is an hommage to the everyman's love story; it showcases the many micro-moments of love that are shared every day by people of all walks of life. It will be an emersive experience that will allow for anyone to relate to the subject matter whether you are in a relationship or not. It will empower the audience to examine their own personal view of love. Due to the fact that it's staged in such an intimate setting, we hope that it sparks individuals to want to connect with one another as well as mend broken hearts and motivate new love.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the love! 

Twitter: @RarelyPTheatre

Instgram: @rarelypuretheatre

story:
We have reached our goal! Thanks!

Any further donations will go towards our other production costs: lighting, costumes, etc. 

The Canadian History Project will present:

In His Name 

- Dollard Des Ormeaux and the Battle of Long Sault 

Written by Robert Tsonos

Directed by Adam Bailey

April 23rd to 27th, 2014

Wed. to Sat. at 8pm, Sunday at 2pm

The Array Space - 155 Walnut Avenue

Help us pay for our rehearsal space before our performances begin on April 23rd. An historical Canadian drama with a cast of eight is almost impossible to produce in this country without help from our friends, families, colleagues, and audience members. This  world premiere deserves to be seen and with your help we can get off on the right footlight.

Set in 1660 in the new colony of Ville Marie (Montreal), In His Name is an historic drama about young men fighting for their country, the loved ones who struggle to save them, and the religious and political ties that control them.

Starring: Ellen Denny, Blythe Haynes, Christopher Isaak, Josh Johnston, Scott McCulloch, Mark Nelson, Clinton Lee Pontes, and Clinton Walker.

No amount is too small. It only takes 100 people to donate $10. 
Or 50 people to donate $20. Please give as much or as little as you can.

Know that your money is going towards the development of a new Canadian play!

Thanks!


Tickets to the production can be purchased on line at:

https://inhisname.eventbrite.ca  

Tickets $20

Call: 416-993-7929

E-Mail: inhisnametickets@hotmail.com

story:
This is a completely student-produced play by Northwestern University students, put on by the student theatre board: Sit & Spin Productions.

Directed by Mallory Moser and produced by Grace Schwartzenberger, This captures the uncertain steps of a circle of friends backing their way into middle age. The story is centered around Jane, a single mother who, to put it simply, is not okay. Her helpful friends are only helping make things more complicated, and everything comes to a head when the truth is the only way out. Melissa James Gibson has written a fast-paced and witty comedy, with back-to-back moments of hilarity, despair, joy and pain.

This is also a site-specific show, 

which means that it takes place in a venue not traditionally used for theatre performance. This year we are thrilled to be partnering with JJ Java, a local cafe in Evanston! 

You can find out more about the project and Sit & Spin Productions on Facebook or by visiting our website!

https://www.facebook.com/SitSpinProductionsPresentsThis?hc_location=stream

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Sit-Spin-Productions/182744960752?fref=ts

http://groups.northwestern.edu/sitandspin/home.html

 

Cast:

Jane - Chelsea Taylor

Marrell - Christabel Donkor

Tom - Justin Leider

Alan - Dan Selinger

Jean-Pierre - Connor Steelberg

Production Team:

  • Producer: Grace Schwartzenberger
  • Director: Mallory Moser
    • Assistant Director: Becca Maier
    • Assistant Director: Emily Martin
  • Stage Manager: Karen Valencia
    • Assistant Stage Manager: Lyndsay Lyhus
  • Costume Designer: Melanie Vitaterna
    • Assistant Costume Designer: Alex Wolfe
  • Co-Props Designer: Justine Gelfman
  • Co-Props Designer: Nathan Lamp
  • Lighting Designer: Dylan Reyno
  • Sound Designer: Kathy Hong
  • Fundraising Director: Kyle Largent
    • Fundraising Team: Sam Douglas & Shaina Wagner
  • Publicity Director: Maddie O'Brien
    • Publicity Team: Katie Incardona & Khari Shelton
  • Graphic Designer: Austin James

 

Performances:

May 9-11 at JJ Java Cafe in Evanston, IL.

Check out JJ Java Cafe on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/jjjavacafe?ref=ts&fref=ts

 

If you have any questions or want to find out more about the show, email our Fundraising Director, Kyle Largent, at KyleLargent2015@u.northwestern.edu or our Producer, Grace Schwartzenberger at GraceSchwartzenberger2015@u.northwestern.edu!

story:
The Project

Mingled Yarn proudly presents the first ever UK revival of two studies of loneliness from the writer of The Killing of Sister George.

“Please don't die,” she kept repeating. I remember thinking: “How funny, whoever wants to die?”

A bedridden blind man summons an ex-soldier to his apartment to spy on a woman from his past in the flat opposite. In a Bayswater bedsit, a young woman examines her old diaries in an attempt to make sense of a history of regret and mistakes.

Let the pages remain clean and blank and unsullied. Only on the very last shall I write an appropriate epitaph.

From 29th September until 17th October, Mingled Yarn transforms The Hope Theatre into two intimate bedchambers as they stage two haunting psychological studies of loneliness, The Window and Blank Pages. From writer Frank Marcus whose plays were noted for their strong parts for female actors, these productions will be directed by his granddaughter, Rafaella Marcus.

Frank Marcus was born in Breslau, Germany in 1928, and emigrated to England in 1939. He wrote more than 20 plays including Notes On A Love Affair, Studies Of The Nude, The Formation Dancers and his best-known work The Killing of Sister George. He won the Variety Award, the Evening Standard Award and Plays and Players Award for The Killing of Sister George, and critics lavished praise on it. As performed by Beryl Reid and Eileen Atkins, the play ran on Broadway for a total of 205 performances in 1966. It was later made into a Robert Aldrich film that starred Beryl Reid and Susannah York. As well as his own plays Frank made several translations and adaptations from his native German, including La Ronde, with his wife Jacqueline. He was theatre critic of the Sunday Telegraph for 10 years from 1968, and contributed regularly to magazines in Britain and America. He died in London in 1996.

“Playwrights of Marcus's disposition and truthful quality cannot be had for love or money”

The Independent

“Enchanting: short, tart, and accomplished” 

The Spectator on The Window




The Company

Mingled Yarn aims to continue the tradition in which drama began by taking old stories and repurposing them for our times. In exploring the oldest and most fundamental stories and plays, we have produced renovations and re-imaginings of classical texts, new plays devised from old tales, and adaptations of myths and books. 

Artistic Director Rafaella Marcus trained in Theatre Directing at Birkbeck and is Associate Director of Prowl Theatre. She has directed at the St James, the Arcola, and the Oxford Playhouse, as well as spending a year as Resident Assistant Director at the Sheffield Crucible and assisting in the West End. Directing credits include Sexual Perversity in Chicago (Camden Fringe); Ad Liberation (St James Theatre Studio); Restoration (Arcola); Harry The King (Edinburgh Fringe); Sonya and Andre, a new piece devised from Chekhov (Sheffield Theatres); The Two Gentlemen of Verona (Brockley Jack Studio Theatre); Laughing Boy (Oxford House Chapel); The Little Prince (Oxford/Edinburgh Fringe/Arcola tour); The Odyssey (Oxford Playhouse). Assistant Director credits include Romeo & Juliet; The Window in the Willows (both Chester Performs); Boeing Boeing; Afterplay; Love Your Soldiers; The Winter’s Tale (all Sheffield Theatres); The Killing of Sister George (West End).

Praise for previous work:

“Outstanding ... storytelling at its best” 

FringeReview on Harry the King

“Terrific...real atmosphere”

A Younger Theatre on Laughing Boy 


What We Need...

In order to make the shows happen at the highest possible quality, we need to raise around £3000. Your money will be spent on:

  • Paying people! Mingled Yarn believes that artists should be paid for their work and has an ongoing commitment to budgeting fees before any other cost. In addition, The Hope Theatre has an in-house agreement with Equity that states that all actors and stage managers must be paid an agreed amount for the hours they put in. We are very pleased and proud to be able to uphold this commitment.
  • Design! We have a fantastic and talented design team with credits at the Royal Court, Sadler's Wells, Sherman Cymru, the Gate, Southwark Playhouse, and the National Youth Theatre among others. We have a very exciting design for the shows and need to be able to execute it well.
  • Marketing! As well as posters and flyers, we will be seeking to advertise the show online, both through banner advertisements and email blasts to mailing lists from whatsonstage etc. These methods have been proven to provide a bump in ticket sales but are very costly - we want to reach as many people as possible and get the word out.
  • Space! London is an expensive place to hire rehearsal rooms for a small company and we need to find enough to rehearse two plays over the course of a month.

... & What You Get

We want you to view donating to us as an investment in the future of a group of talented individual artists and a great company. We recognise that any amount you give is extremely generous so we're offering a range of rewards and perks (on the right) but are open to suggestions as well! If you think we can offer you a service in return - advertising your business in our programme, one to one coaching on public speaking with our director or actors, sharing our skills, or even making you a lovely dinner - get in touch and let's have a conversation.
Even if we don't make it to our goal of £3000, all contributions will make a big difference to us. Your money will go directly into carpeting the theatre, providing the designer with enough pencils, or even ensuring that there's milk for the tea.

The Impact

The theatre we want to make is honest, thrilling, accessible, inventive, and unites the best of the stories we already know with those yet to be told. At The Hope, we can offer you an intimate experience rediscovering the work of an important 20th century playwright for £14. That's already £226 less than tickets for Elf the Musical.

We're also so excited to be bringing Frank Marcus' work to the Hope for the first time, and reintroducing his exciting and varied work to a modern audience. We hope that this is the beginning of a rediscovery of Frank's beautiful writing.  

Our last project, Harry the King, couldn't have happened without crowdfunding, and led directly into the creation of this one through the people we met and relationships we formed while doing it. By contributing, you are helping us to make something great, both now and in the years to come.


Risks & Challenges

We are producing two relatively unknown plays that we believe are as resonant and moving now as they were when first written, and we hope the audience loves them as much as we do. However, it means we have to work extra hard to sell them and convince audiences to take a gamble, which we will be doing through radio, web features, and social media.

Theatre is an expensive business and unexpected costs have a nasty tendency of cropping up. Although we as a team have a good track record of keeping costs low and finding innovative solutions, your support will help us to tackle those speed bumps head on.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute, you can still help! Get out there on Twitter with the hashtag #MarcusPlays and Facebook and make some noise about the crowdfunding campaign and the shows - and come and see them yourself. As theatre-makers, the most valuable thing we can ask for is that you come and see our work, enjoy it, and help us get better at what we do. 

And that's about it. 

Many, many thanks from Mingled Yarn, and we wish you all the best.

story:
STRETCH GOALS

We've made it to $1000! Thank you so much for helping us secure rehearsal space and a design materials budget.
All donations over and above this will be going directly to artist honoraria. Currently the compensation for 4 weeks of rehearsal and performance for this show is sitting at $425 for Director, Actors, and Stage Manager, $300 for Designer, and $250 for Playwright. Anything you can give will help us pay closer to living wages to these incredible artists.


One of Us Must Know

David Walker's new play One of Us Must Know is a raw and poetic take on toxic love. Dirt Buffet Theatre will be staging it in a highly physical, non-realistic style using elements of dance, puppetry, improvisation and contemporary theatre.

The Expanse Movement Arts Festival will be premiering this challenging, new Canadian work as part of their February 2016 festival. 

What We Need

Expanse is able to support artist honoraria, but we need aid for production elements: 

  • We need to pay for rehearsal space at Mile Zero Dance - $600
  • We need a budget for our designer - $400

The Creative Team

We have an incredible group of artists working on this project:

  • David Walker: Playwright
  • Ben Gorodetsky: Director
  • Cheyenne Sykes: Scenic Designer
  • Andrea Murphy: Stage Manager 
  • Aaron Read: Composer/Sound Designer
  • Gerry Morita: Physical Dramaturge
  • Murray Utas: Directorial Mentorship
  • Nancy McAlear: Actor 
  • Miranda Allen: Actor


Artistic Quality 

This is a play that an incredible number of artists and organizations believe in. And for good reason; it is scary, funny, beautiful, shocking all at the same time. An adventurous new style of performance that is distinctly Canadian. We are passionate about this work and we ask for your support in ensuring the quality and professionalism of our production.
story_txt:
STRETCH GOALS
We've made it to $1000! Thank you so much for helping us secure rehearsal space and a design materials budget. All donations over and above this will be going directly to artist honoraria. Currently the compensation for 4 weeks of rehearsal and performance for this show is sitting at $425 for Director, Actors, and Stage Manager, $300 for Designer, and $250 for Playwright. Anything you can give will help us pay closer to living wages to these incredible artists.
One of Us Must Know David Walker's new play One of Us Must Know is a raw and poetic take on toxic love. Dirt Buffet Theatre will be staging it in a highly physical, non-realistic style using elements of dance, puppetry, improvisation and contemporary theatre. The Expanse Movement Arts Festival will be premiering this challenging, new Canadian work as part of their February 2016 festival.    What We Need Expanse is able to support artist honoraria, but we need aid for production elements:   We need to pay for rehearsal space at Mile Zero Dance - $600 We need a budget for our designer - $400
    The Creative Team We have an incredible group of artists working on this project:  David Walker: Playwright
Ben Gorodetsky: Director
Cheyenne Sykes: Scenic Designer Andrea Murphy: Stage Manager 

Aaron Read: Composer/Sound Designer

Gerry Morita: Physical Dramaturge

Murray Utas: Directorial Mentorship
Nancy McAlear: Actor 
Miranda Allen: Actor

An adventurous new style of performance that is distinctly Canadian. We are passionate about this work and we ask for your support in ensuring the quality and professionalism of our production.

story:
Since 2009, iMEE has provided quality dance presentations through multi-disciplinary collaborations and programming for audiences in United States and abroad.  The company has participated in numerous Festivals, including: 

  • Weekend of Texas Contemporary Dance 2009, 2010, 2011/ Houston, TX 
  • Houston Dance Festival 2011/ Houston, TX  
  • The Dance Gallery Festival 2011, 2012/ Huntsville, TX & New York, NY
  • FestOval of Dance 2012/ West Palm Beach, FL
  • McCallum Theatre’s 15th Annual Choreography Festival 2012/ Palm Desert, CA  
  • Palcoscenico de Danza 2013/ Turin, Italy 
  • Boston Contemporary Dance Festival 2014/ Boston, MA 
  • Mass Dance Festival 2014/ Amherst, MA  
  • and soon... the black box INTERNATIONAL FESTIVAL THEATRE & DANCE May 31 - June 10, 2015/ Plovdiv, Bulgaria  
     

iMEE will present the sum of four / duets + quartets at the black box INTERNATIONAL FESTIVAL THEATRE & DANCE (the black box ITDF) in Plovdiv, Bulgaria in late May, early June 2015.  Help iMEE get "Across the pond" for our second European tour.  Please assist us with our travel costs so we may share our vision with European audiences for the second time! 

What is iMEE presenting & What is the black box IFTD?

iMEE Co-Director, Andrea D. Shelley was invited by the black box IFTD in Plovdiv, Bulgaria to present 30 minutes of her choreography.  iMEE will present the sum of four / duets + quartets which will feature two of Shelley’s acclaimed duets, IVONICE & UNTITLED alongside excerpts of Superfluous, an ensemble work created by Shelley & iMEE Co-Director, Spencer Gavin Hering.   What is the black box ITDF?  Since 2007, the Festival has featured innovative theatre and dance companies from all over the world, presenting 66 performances from 25 countries. the black box ITDF presents original, challenging international plays and dance performances.  (the black box ITDF is organized by the Black Box Foundation in partnership with the Municipality of Plovdiv and the Ministry of Culture of the Republic of Bulgaria. To learn more about the black box ITDF, visit their website.)

What we need & Why we need your help. . .

The Festival will provide housing, food, and transfers from the airport in Sofia, Bulgaria to Plovdiv, Bulgaria for all iMEE artists & staff.  FUN FACT: Did you know that Festivals rarely (if ever) cover travel costs, which is usually the most expensive aspect of touring?  Well, now you know and here's where your help will come in.  iMEE needs your assistance with raising funds for five round trip airfares for four of our dancers and one lighting designer from Boston, MA or New York, NY to Sofia, Bulgaria.  Round trip airfares to Eastern Europe are especially steep and we need your help to get iMEE "Across the pond!"  Let us break it down… four dancers + one lighting designer = $5,857.50  (for five round trip airfares.)  This hefty price tag is based on early booking prices, as of 11/20/2014.  In the efforts to avoid rising airfare costs we need to raise funds for five round trip airfares by early 2015.  There are also luggage fees as well as campaigning fees to consider so, we've rounded up and look to raise a total of $6,000.  

Perhaps you are unable to make a contribution at this time & wonder… "How else can I help iMEE?" 

Well… you can help us by sharing and reposting our campaign, of course.   Share "the sum of four: iMEE travels to Bulgaria" campaign with your friends via Email, Facebook, Indiegogo or any social media outlet possible and spread the word about iMEE's upcoming European tour.  You might also consider donating your sky miles and help us "fly the friendly skies" in this manner.  This is a really great option which has helped us tremendously with touring in the past.  Sky mile donations are an invaluable, in-kind contribution.  

Please keep in mind that there is NO amount too small (or too big) and any   contribution will make an impact on our participation at the black box IFTD in Bulgaria this summer. Even if we do not reach our complete goal (which we hope  that we will with your help!,) all monies raised will go directly to the purchasing of as many airfares as possible.  We'll say it again and shout it from the mountain tops,  your contribution in any amount will make a difference in helping us get "Across the pond!"  Individual donations are the lifeblood of iMEE.

What's in it for you?

Well…. you might just find yourself feeling a great deal of satisfaction in knowing that your contribution helped iMEE present our work to European audiences for a second time (a FUN FACT that we are very proud of by the way!)  You can share in our excitement and take ownership in knowing that your generosity & belief in what we do will have played a major role in our being successful.  FUN FACT:  You will have our INFINITE GRATITUDE, some "epic" karma coming your way and… some pretty dope perks!  You'll be with us every step of the way and receive email updates & pictures during our rehearsal process and while we are on tour in Bulgaria!

Say what? Say it again, just one more time?

Ok…. Help iMEE raise $6,000 for five round trip airfares.  Your support will help us continue to realize our goal of becoming a touring company of national & international prominence. We hope that you will be inspired to include iMEE in your Holiday giving. Become part of the equation by making a contribution that will have us "flying the friendly skies" to get "Across the pond" to Bulgaria and present the sum of four / duets + quartets at the black box ITDF  this Summer 2015! 

Your generosity + your belief = iMEE in Bulgaria 2015! 

INFINITE GRATITUDE…                                                                      
www.imeedanceco.com

story:
Greetings!

*UPDATE*

FOR THOSE THAT MAY NOT HAVE THE TIME TO READ OUR FULL PITCH; REALLY, NO DONATION IS TOO SMALL!  WE NEED YOUR FINANCIAL SUPPORT NOW AND EVERY LITTLE BIT HELPS!

* END OF UPDATE*

Wild Women Theatre is an emerging theatre company comprised of some of the founding members of the performance ensemble The Saartjie Project which had its final production in 2012. This July we are coming back to the Capital Fringe Festival with our production, Four Women, directed by our own Farah Lawal.

There is no monolithic experience of black womanhood. Wild Women Theatre realizes that there are too few tales of black womanhood told by black women themselves. We are bombarded with images about our worth from the larger society, but rarely do we get to examine and display how we feel in our own bodies, words and voices. Four Women is a performance for women (and men) that works to address that disparity through the lens of Nina Simone's song, "Four Women."

Though this work is a labor of love, we need your assistance to bring this production to its true stage capability. We believe in honoring the work of fellow artists and this fundraiser will assist with the paying of stipends to the various technical professionals who will work with us while also covering various production costs.

We are asking for $3,000 to cover:

  • stage manager
  • lighting designer
  • light board operator
  • sound board operator
  • promotional material design and printing
  • photographer
  • videographer

We are each deeply and personally committed to this work and are also contributing what we are able to individually. Now we are turning to you, our community of artists, creative architects, scholars, activists, and people who love black women (that should encompass just about everyone of y’all right?) to assist us.  We have some thank you gifts listed on the side to show our appreciation of your support.

No amount is too great or too small, but we are asking for donations to start at $5.

If you are not able to support us financially at this time, please help us spread the word and consider coming to one of our performances in July!

July 16th at 6:45 pm

July 21st at 6:30 pm

July 25th at 6:45 pm

July 27th at 2:30 pm

 

Studio Theatre – Stage 4

1501 14th Street, NW

(At the intersection of 14th & P St NW in Logan Circle)

 

Tickets & Passes and be purchased through capitalfringe.org or by calling 866-811-4111.

Thank you in advance for your gift either monetarily or in the kindness of spreading the word to your networks.

 

Best regards,

Wild Women Theatre
